_comment: Canada compliance norms and standards database. Includes ISED (formerly Industry Canada), CSA, Health Canada, NRCan, CCPSA and other Canadian regulatory requirements. Updated for 2025 compliance requirements.

norms.name: Information Technology Equipment (ITE) - EMC Requirements
norms.description: Interference-Causing Equipment Standard for digital apparatus. Class A (commercial) and Class B (residential) limits. Compliance mark required. Self-certification with test reports.

norms.name: General Requirements for Radio Equipment
norms.description: General requirements for radio apparatus. Labeling, technical documentation, RF exposure compliance. Foundation standard for all wireless devices. IC certification mark required.

norms.name: 2.4GHz and 5GHz Licence-Exempt Radio Apparatus
norms.description: Technical requirements for 2.4GHz and 5GHz unlicensed devices. Covers WiFi, Bluetooth, Zigbee. Power limits, DFS requirements for 5GHz. Mandatory for wireless devices.

norms.name: Low-Power Licence-Exempt Radio Apparatus
norms.description: Requirements for various low-power devices including remote controls, wireless sensors, RFID, wireless microphones. Field strength limits by frequency band.

norms.name: Radio Frequency Exposure Compliance
norms.description: RF exposure evaluation procedures. SAR limits for portable devices (1.6 W/kg averaged over 1g). MPE limits for fixed transmitters. Mandatory compliance evaluation.

norms.name: Cellular and PCS Equipment
norms.description: Technical requirements for cellular equipment operating in various cellular bands. Covers GSM, CDMA, LTE, 5G devices.

norms.name: Audio/Video, ICT and Communication Technology Equipment - Safety
norms.description: Canadian adoption of IEC 62368-1. Hazard-based safety standard for ICT equipment. CSA certification mark widely required. Replaces C22.2 No. 60950-1.

norms.name: Information Technology Equipment - Safety (LEGACY)
norms.description: LEGACY standard for IT equipment safety. Withdrawn December 2020, replaced by C22.2 No. 62368-1. May still be valid for existing certifications.

norms.name: General Requirements - Canadian Electrical Code, Part II
norms.description: General construction requirements for electrical equipment. Foundation for many product-specific CSA standards. Covers materials, components, construction methods.

norms.name: Household Appliances - Safety - General Requirements
norms.description: General safety requirements for household appliances. Canadian adoption of IEC 60335-1. Part 1 of comprehensive series. CSA mark required.

norms.name: Household Appliances - Safety - Particular Requirements
norms.description: Part 2 series with specific requirements for different appliances. Multiple parts covering specific products (vacuum cleaners, coffee makers, heaters, etc.).

norms.name: Audio, Video and Similar Electronic Apparatus - Safety Requirements
norms.description: Safety standard for AV equipment. Being replaced by C22.2 No. 62368-1. Transition period until full adoption of new standard.

norms.name: Lithium Batteries - Safety Requirements
norms.description: Safety requirements for portable lithium secondary cells and batteries. Canadian adoption of IEC 62133-2. Required for battery products.

norms.name: Power Conversion Equipment
norms.description: General use power supplies. Covers AC-DC adapters, internal power supplies, DC-DC converters. Alternative to using 62368-1 for standalone power supplies.

norms.name: Luminaires
norms.description: General requirements for luminaires. Covers fixed and portable lighting. Based on UL 1598 with Canadian deviations.

norms.name: LED Equipment for Lighting
norms.description: Safety requirements specific to LED equipment. Covers LED modules, drivers, complete LED luminaires.

norms.name: Energy Efficiency Regulations (SOR/2016-152)
norms.applies_to: Energy-using products including electronics, appliances, lighting
norms.description: Mandatory minimum energy performance standards. Products must meet requirements before import or interprovincial sale. Covers 50+ product categories. Import registration required.

norms.name: EnerGuide Energy Consumption Label
norms.applies_to: Appliances and equipment with labeling requirements
norms.description: Mandatory energy label showing energy consumption. Required for appliances like refrigerators, dishwashers, clothes washers. Helps consumers compare energy use.

norms.name: ENERGY STAR Certification (Canadian Program)
norms.description: Voluntary program for energy-efficient products. Administered by NRCan. Canadian specifications often aligned with US EPA but may differ. Market advantage and government procurement preference.

norms.name: Canada Consumer Product Safety Act
norms.description: Framework legislation for consumer product safety. Prohibits sale of dangerous products. Mandatory incident reporting. Recall powers. Enforced by Health Canada.

norms.name: Toys Regulations
norms.description: Mandatory safety requirements for toys. Mechanical hazards, flammability, toxicity. Heavy metal limits. Choking hazard warnings. Based on ASTM F963 and other international standards.

norms.name: Phthalates Regulations
norms.applies_to: Children's toys and child care articles
norms.description: Prohibits phthalates in soft vinyl children's products that can be placed in mouth. Applies to toys and child care articles for children under 4 years.

norms.name: Surface Coating Materials Regulations (Lead)
norms.applies_to: Products with surface coatings accessible to children
norms.description: Lead limits in surface coating materials. 90 mg/kg limit. Applies to furniture, toys, equipment accessible to children under 7 years.

norms.name: Children's Sleepwear Regulations
norms.description: Flammability requirements for children's sleepwear up to size 14X. Tight-fitting design or flame-resistant fabric. Testing requirements.

norms.name: Medical Device Regulation and Licensing
norms.description: Medical device regulations under Food and Drugs Act. Classification I-IV based on risk. Pre-market authorization required (Class II-IV). Medical Device Establishment License (MDEL) required.

norms.name: Medical Devices - Quality Management Systems
norms.description: Quality management system requirements for medical device manufacturers. Canadian adoption of ISO 13485. Required for Health Canada licensing.

norms.name: Medical Devices - Risk Management
norms.description: Risk management requirements for medical devices. Canadian adoption of ISO 14971. Required for regulatory submissions.

norms.name: Medical Device Establishment License
norms.description: Mandatory license for importing or distributing medical devices in Canada. QMS requirements. Annual fees. Inspections by Health Canada.

norms.id: Food and Drug Regulations - Food Contact
norms.name: Food Packaging Materials
norms.description: Requirements for food contact materials under Food and Drugs Act. Lists of permitted substances. Migration limits. No pre-market notification like FDA FCN but must comply with lists.

norms.name: Canadian Environmental Protection Act
norms.description: Framework for environmental protection including chemicals management. Domestic Substances List (DSL). New substance notification. Toxic substances controls.

norms.name: CMP - Chemical Assessment and Risk Management
norms.description: Risk assessment and management of chemicals. Some substances prohibited or restricted. Affects product materials and components. Regular updates to assessed substances.

norms.name: VOC Limits for Consumer Products
norms.applies_to: Consumer and commercial products with VOCs
norms.description: VOC concentration limits for various product categories including aerosols, adhesives, coatings. Reduces air pollution and smog formation.

norms.name: TDG - Shipping of Dangerous Goods
norms.description: Requirements for shipping dangerous goods. Harmonized with UN Model Regulations. Includes lithium battery shipping requirements (UN 38.3 testing). Classification, packaging, marking, documentation.

norms.name: Lithium Battery Transport Testing
norms.applies_to: Lithium cells and batteries for shipment
norms.description: Mandatory testing for lithium batteries before transport. Eight tests including altitude, thermal, vibration, shock, external short circuit. Test summary required.

norms.name: Vehicle Safety Requirements
norms.description: Safety standards for vehicles sold in Canada. Administered by Transport Canada. Similar to US FMVSS but with Canadian-specific requirements. National Safety Mark required.

norms.name: CPLA - Packaging and Labelling Requirements
norms.description: Mandatory packaging and labeling requirements. Bilingual labeling (English and French). Product identity, dealer name/address, net quantity, declaration requirements. Enforced by CFIA.

norms.name: English and French Language Requirements
norms.applies_to: All consumer products sold in Canada
norms.description: Mandatory bilingual labeling for consumer products. Both official languages (English and French) required for most label information. Exceptions for some information. Critical compliance requirement.

norms.name: False or Misleading Representations
norms.description: Prohibits false or misleading representations to consumers. Applies to advertising, packaging, labeling. Performance claims, testing substantiation. Enforced by Competition Bureau.

norms.name: Trademark Protection and False Origin
norms.description: Protects trademarks and prohibits false indications of origin. Affects product labeling, branding. Made in Canada claims must be substantiated. Administered by CIPO.

norms.id: Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act
norms.name: PIPEDA - Privacy Law
norms.applies_to: Organizations collecting, using, disclosing personal information
norms.description: Federal privacy law for private sector. Requirements for consent, safeguards, transparency, access. Applies to commercial activities. Enforced by Privacy Commissioner. Relevant for connected devices, software.

norms.name: Canadian Centre for Cyber Security Guidelines
norms.description: Cybersecurity guidance and baseline controls. Not mandatory for commercial products but best practices. Important for government procurement and critical infrastructure.

norms.name: Information Security Management Systems
norms.description: Canadian adoption of ISO/IEC 27001. Information security management requirements. Voluntary but widely adopted. Important for B2B and government sales.

norms.name: Quality Management Systems
norms.description: Canadian adoption of ISO 9001. Quality management system requirements. Voluntary but widely recognized. SCC (Standards Council of Canada) accredits certification bodies.

norms.name: Environmental Management Systems
norms.description: Canadian adoption of ISO 14001. Environmental management system requirements. Voluntary but increasingly expected.

norms.name: CEC - Electrical Installation Code
norms.description: Electrical installation requirements (C22.1). Not directly for product compliance but affects installed equipment. Provincial adoption. Important for understanding installation context.

norms.name: CSA Certification Mark
norms.description: Widely recognized safety certification mark. CSA Group is OSHA-recognized NRTL. CSA mark accepted in Canada and US. Various marks including C, US, C-US.

norms.id: Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada (ISED) Mark
norms.name: IC Certification Mark
norms.description: Mandatory compliance mark for radio and EMC equipment. Format: IC: XXXXX-YYYYYY (certification number). Must be visible on product or packaging. Formerly Industry Canada.

norms.name: WHMIS 2015 - GHS Implementation
norms.description: Canadian implementation of GHS (Globally Harmonized System). Hazard classification, labeling, safety data sheets. Affects chemicals, mixtures, industrial products. Aligned with GHS Rev 5.

norms.name: Environmental Impact Assessment
norms.description: Environmental assessment requirements for major projects. Not directly product compliance but relevant for manufacturing facilities, infrastructure.
